website_summaries.verdict: Designed for foragers of all ages, this is an informative book that’s easy to transport and comes at an impressive value.
pros: This is a useful field guide written for all ages, even young scouts
Includes an informative section about the preparation of wild plants to make them suitable for consumption
Book is small in size, making it easy to take on a camping trip or hike
cons: Some featured images are not as close up as they could be to showcase the plant

customer_reviews.title: A must have for wild edible enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the title fool you you. This book is a must have for all ages and levels of foragers and wild edible enthusiasts. Five decades as a middle school life sciences teacher and scout master shine in this guide where Mike shares his life long passion and collected knowledge of wild edibles. It covers all of the most common wild edibles, is concise, informative, easy to read, has wonderful photos and his DIY recipes and projects are fun for everyone. I love this guide and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: walter w.

customer_reviews.title: Mike - We Want More Books
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book to lead into and teach eatable plants. It is more centered for the areas of the states that have moderate rainfall... Mike really needs to produce a series of books that can offer a regional pallet of foods. Here in central Texas that means foods with thorns... Over in West Texas??? Well I don't know??? Can we eat rocks??? Kidding aside I am glade to have this book on my shelf and on my excursions...
customer_reviews.author: John A. Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Book was smaller in size then I was expecting, but not in content. My son was able to identify edibles on his own using this book. I also learned what all those "eerie" dark green circles growing in my lawn are. Turns out, they are not types of crop circles (though, the truth is out there.)
customer_reviews.author: K.T.

customer_reviews.title: Nice resource - simple but good.
customer_reviews.text: The book was basic in information but informative. I nice resource for the household and for camping trips. The book is small and easy to take with you - half inch thick. This is not a pamphlet like some of the other 'resources' are (been mislead by that before). Good color pictures, too.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Doe

customer_reviews.title: Reliable ID tips & photos. Includes Scout projects..
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Kindle edition after following Mike Krebill on Facebook. He's a knowledgeable forager! This book has reliable tips & photos for the novice learning about wild edibles. I'm especially looking forward to learning to identify the fungi highlighted in this book. I appreciate that the spore print colors are included in the descriptions.
customer_reviews.author: Kate in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: Mike Krebil was my kid's science teacher way back in another life. His love for the great outdoors was evident then as well as in his book. And now my oldest daughter is sharing his wisdom with her own daughters. How cool is that?
customer_reviews.author: microtv

customer_reviews.title: awesome book
customer_reviews.text: was looking for survival food book, has awesome pics and full descriptions, around 40 -50 plants mushrooms to eat, ive seen all of these plants in michigan and west virginia, theres recipes and food storage and prep for each plant i love this book and had i got this first i wouldnt own three other books that suck. GET THIS BOOK you will be glad toy did.
customer_reviews.author: lon charbonneau

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful pictures, clear descriptions and recipes that are easy ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful pictures, clear descriptions and recipes that are easy to follow and taste GREAT! both sons have copies as well as the two of us with one for the scout troop we hope to help with in the coming years. Our favorite might be the Dandelion recipes! The neighbor children love to help pick the flowers. All of mr. krebills research comes through with flying colors. An AWESOME book to have or gift!
customer_reviews.author: Jane M. McTavish

customer_reviews.title: usable information
customer_reviews.text: The book is a well laid out guide with great photos on quality paper. He does a good job of giving the info needed (region, season for harvesting, edible parts of the plant, etc.) in clear outline form. Very readable and understandable; you don't glaze over with paragraphs of boring botanical text. Most of the 40 wild edibles grow throughout USA mainland, which I was glad to see. Would have preferred more edibles over recipes, but it's a great start.
customer_reviews.author: KKC

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this book. I was disappointed. It needed more pictures and description of other seasons when you will encounter these plants.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book for children and those new to foraging!
customer_reviews.text: The thing that makes this book shine for me is the most crucial detailed color pictures. And the recipes are most fun!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Mike Krebill does a great job of explaining identification
customer_reviews.text: Mike Krebill does a great job of explaining identification, harvesting, and cooking wild edibles. As a student of his 5th grade science teacher, this was the teacher that could get me to focus. I'm sad I missed the book signing because of an illness. Buying another 2 copies to give as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Marrs

customer_reviews.title: Great for non-rookies.
customer_reviews.text: Great if you already know a bit about plant identity or are good at recognizing things. I think if you're brand new to plant identity and foraging, you might find this overwhelming. I'd consider this a reference, not a "how to."
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner book for scouts
customer_reviews.text: Very good book for beginners, highly recommend to boy scouts to get started with wild edibles.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlie Kavanagh

customer_reviews.title: Not enough close up pictures to show exactly what a plant looks like.
customer_reviews.text: Fairly decent book. Not enough close up pictures to show exactly what a plant looks like.
customer_reviews.author: da

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Good to have for the collapse of the world as we know it or just for general knowledge
customer_reviews.author: Martin Q.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing book, very helpful!!
customer_reviews.text: Mr. Krebill was my science teacher at KMS in 7th grade. He's very knowledgeable and loves to teach others what he knows. In class we had a competition to see who could find the longest dandelion stem, we ate dandelion donuts, and walnut bread with black walnuts the students brought in. I still talk about how fun this class was, and it was over 10 years ago! I love to spend my time outdoors, and explore what we could possibly eat if we were stranded out in the wilderness around us. This book is amazing and has definitely helped me learn new things! You won't go wrong with this one!!
customer_reviews.author: Haley Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Lunch is Served
customer_reviews.text: Ever pepper needs one of these in their bug out bag.
customer_reviews.author: Freeman

customer_reviews.title: ... an early Christmas gift to my neighbors - they love it!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as an early Christmas gift to my neighbors - they love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Tweedy

customer_reviews.title: Will travel!
customer_reviews.text: This book is nice and small, is legible and has pics! It’s also going to resist water or dirty muddy hands while in use.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Jo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a good one. Any one interested in foraging will like this book.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Culp

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great resource for scout leaders, amateur foragers, and outdoor programs. My son loves it, as do I.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Bragg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Packed full of useful info. I love the format. Well written, concise and a pleasure to read. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Balisteri

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to daughter.....she says she likes it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: furrawn

customer_reviews.title: Great Wild Edible Plant Guide
customer_reviews.text: Very clear identification info. & instructions for use of edible wild plants. Great ideas for use with kids.
customer_reviews.author: Christine K.

customer_reviews.title: Images are clear and are a good representation of the plants
customer_reviews.text: Simple and spot on with plant identification. Images are clear and are a good representation of the plants.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Mike Krebill is a great teacher and I really enjoyed his book.
customer_reviews.author: Kathie R. Mashni

customer_reviews.title: wery interesting book. I hope newer to need it ...
customer_reviews.text: wery interesting book.I hope newer to need it in survival situation.
customer_reviews.author: Vaclav Jericha

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginning to forage!
customer_reviews.text: If you're at all interested in foraging, this is a fabulous beginners book. Great photos and descriptions of wild edibles, where to find them, when to find them, and what lookalikes to watch out for. Even recipes to use the wild edibles in! I love the sumac lemonade and can't wait to start identifying and using more wild things around me in my food this year! Mike Krebill is great at what he does and he wrote a fabulous book!
customer_reviews.author: Lighthouse

customer_reviews.title: Carry this with you!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent compilation ( compendium?) of information. This author definitely knows his field and makes it available for the rest of us.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce C. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Great hand guide
customer_reviews.text: Great hand guide. Nice illustrations and shows the difference between the plants.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Book with nature knowledge
customer_reviews.text: A lot of information in this book... important info on mushrooms if your new to the nature life.
customer_reviews.author: Winona Rich

customer_reviews.title: We all need some of this info. , good for survival also.
customer_reviews.text: A concise book for beginners or those just learning. Everyone should have some of this knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

product_meta.title: The Scout's Guide to Wild Edibles: Learn How To Forage, Prepare & Eat 40 Wild Foods
